trip_description: Climb Grays & Torreys Peak in one day
notes: Your introduction to the Front Range

trip_description: Climb Grays & Torreys Peak in one day
notes: Your introduction to class 2 climbing

trip_description: Only Quandary
notes: Your introduction to the Mosquito/Tenmile Range. Take the shuttle or get a parking permit before you go.

trip_description: Only Bierstadt
notes: Check out the Sawtooth as a class 3 alternative if you have experience climbing

trip_description: Only Huron
notes: Your introduction to the Sawatch Range

trip_description: Climb Dem, Cam, Linc, Bross in one day
notes: Climb all 4 peaks in one day along the Decalibron

trip_description: Climb Dem, Cam, Linc, Bross in one day
notes: Climb all 4 peaks in one day along the Decalibron

trip_description: Climb Dem, Cam, Linc, Bross in one day
notes: Climb all 4 peaks in one day along the Decalibron

trip_description: Climb Dem, Cam, Linc, Bross in one day
notes: Climb all 4 peaks in one day along the Decalibron

trip_description: Only Evans
notes: Be mindful of the Evans permit requirments during the summer.

trip_description: Only Humboldt
notes: Your introduction to backpacking trips

trip_description: Only Princeton
notes: Another rough road to the TH. Multiple pull-off's above the trailhead for 4WD vehicles.

trip_description: Climb Massive & Elbert with a break in between
notes: One of my favorite 14ers for overnight backpacking trips.

trip_description: Climb Massive & Elbert with a break in between
notes: Summit the tallest peak in the Rocky Mountains!

trip_description: Only Sherman
notes: Your introduction to snow climbing. Get some crampons and an ice axe to bring with you along the south slopes.

trip_description: Only Culebra
notes: Your introduction to the Sangres - plan ahead to buy a permit

trip_description: Only Yale
notes: This is a great training peak to repeate while getting ready for bigger, harder climbs in the future.

trip_description: Climb Challenger & Kit in one overnight trip
notes: There are great camping areas just below Willow Lake which allows for an easier early morning summit bid.

trip_description: Climb Challenger & Kit in one overnight trip
notes: It's easy to get lost on Kit Carson's upper terrain. Take careful notes and make sure you can identify the right points to turn.

trip_description: Climb Sneffels & San Luis with a break in between
notes: Your introduction to the San Juans & class 3 climbing

trip_description: Climb Sneffels & San Luis with a break in between
notes: The trailhead is harder to reach than the summit. Bring 4WD.

trip_description: Climb Shavano & Tabeguache in one day
notes: This is another good snow climb - slightly more difficult than Sherman.

trip_description: Climb Shavano & Tabeguache in one day
notes: You need to climb Shavano to get to Tabeguache so pick a day with low thunderstorm risk or you'll have to do them both again.

trip_description: Climb Castle & Conundrum in one day
notes: Your introduction to the Elk Mountains. Bring an ice axe and crampons.

trip_description: Climb Castle & Conundrum in one day
notes: Your introduction to the Elk Mountains. Bring an ice axe and crampons.

trip_description: Only Longs
notes: The only 14er in a national park. A 2 am start time is recommended to finish before afternoon storms are an issue - and so you can find parking.

trip_description: Climb Belford, Oxford, Missiouri in one overnight trip
notes: This is a relatively big trip. If you prefer you can split it up and do Belford and Oxford on one trip and Missouri on another.

trip_description: Climb Belford, Oxford, Missiouri in one overnight trip
notes: This is a relatively big trip. If you prefer you can split it up and do Belford and Oxford on one trip and Missouri on another.

trip_description: Climb Belford, Oxford, Missiouri in one overnight trip
notes: This is a relatively big trip. If you prefer you can split it up and do Belford and Oxford on one trip and Missouri on another.

trip_description: Climb North Maroon and Maroon with a break in between
notes: Your introduction to class 4 climbing. Get a permit to ensure you can visit. I recommend a PLB for all class 4 climbs.

trip_description: Climb North Maroon and Maroon with a break in between
notes: The elks are notorious for their loose rock. Be careful, go when conditions are ideal, and test every handhold before you put your weight on it.

trip_description: Only La Plata
notes: Want some more challenge? Do the class 3 route alternative Ellingwood Ridge. It's a long, tough day with difficult route-finding.

trip_description: Climb Handies, Redcloud, Sunshine with a break in between
notes: This day will be a bit longer if you don't have a 4WD vehicle to make it to the higher trailhead.

trip_description: Climb Handies, Redcloud, Sunshine with a break in between
notes: Don't take shortcuts on this peak - you may quickly find yourself in more difficult and dangerous terrain.

trip_description: Climb Handies, Redcloud, Sunshine with a break in between
notes: Don't take shortcuts on this peak - you may quickly find yourself in more difficult and dangerous terrain.

trip_description: Only Lindsey
notes: **Mount Lindsey is temporarily closed to the public.**

trip_description: Climb Wilson and El Diente in one overnight trip
notes: These peaks are known for their rockfall, so wear a helmet and be extra cautious with your handholds and movement.

trip_description: Climb Wilson and El Diente in one overnight trip
notes: These peaks are known for their rockfall, so wear a helmet and be extra cautious with your handholds and movement.

trip_description: Only Snowmass
notes: Snowmass is usually done with snow - hope you practiced on Sherman and Shavano! Bring an ice axe, crampons, and helmet

trip_description: Climb Ellingwood, Blanca in one overnight trip
notes: This climb has a bit of exposure near the summit to be wary of. Lots of good campsites at Lake Como and along the road below.

trip_description: Climb Ellingwood, Blanca in one overnight trip
notes: This climb has a bit of exposure near the summit to be wary of. Lots of good campsites at Lake Como and along the road below.

trip_description: Climb Chicago Basin Group in one multi-day trip
notes: Take the train to Needleton! https://www.durangotrain.com/wilderness-access/

trip_description: Climb Chicago Basin Group in one multi-day trip
notes: Take the train to Needleton! https://www.durangotrain.com/wilderness-access/

trip_description: Climb Chicago Basin Group in one multi-day trip
notes: Take the train to Needleton! https://www.durangotrain.com/wilderness-access/

trip_description: Climb Chicago Basin Group in one multi-day trip
notes: Take the train to Needleton! https://www.durangotrain.com/wilderness-access/

trip_description: Only Pikes
notes: The longest route up any of the 14ers. Recommend an overnight at Barr Camp!

trip_description: Climb Harvard & Columbia in one overnight trip
notes: Lots of up and down on this route. Don't try following the ridge traverse itself, it will lead to class 5 climbing.

trip_description: Climb Harvard & Columbia in one overnight trip
notes: Lots of up and down on this route. Don't try following the ridge traverse itself, it will lead to class 5 climbing.

trip_description: Only Wilson
notes: These peaks are known for their rockfall, so wear a helmet and be extra cautious with your handholds and movement.

trip_description: Only Antero
notes: If you have a 4X4 vehicle you can make it very high up on the peak before you need to get out and hike.

trip_description: Only Pyramid
notes: Pyramid is only a bit more solid than the Maroon Bells, but it's quieter so less people are around, making navigation more difficult.

trip_description: Only Mount of the Holy Cross
notes: I highly recommend doing Halo Ridge if you're up for a longer day. The famous view of the Cross east face is worth it.

trip_description: Climb Crestone Peak & Needle with a break in between
notes: Be mindful or early season snow that may be draining down the Red Gully.

trip_description: Climb Crestone Peak & Needle with a break in between
notes: Navigation is the biggest risk on the Needle. Carefully research the route, especially where you must switch from one gully to another. It is easy to miss.

trip_description: Only Little Bear
notes: The Hourglass is infamous for falling rock. Wear a helmet and don't trust any ropes you didn't place yourself.

trip_description: Climb Wetterhorn & Uncompahgre with a break in between
notes: Many people argue that Wetterhorn is one of the best overall fourteeners of them all, so I saved the best for close to last!

trip_description: Climb Wetterhorn & Uncompahgre with a break in between
notes: One last nondescript class two peak before we go tackle the hardest of them all.

trip_description: Only Capitol
notes: The most difficult of all the 14ers. Go slow and be careful!
